active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the misconception that 'registry data is always overwritten on deletion.' Provide examples of how slack space and unallocated cells can reveal deleted malicious Run key entries linked to MITRE ATT&CK T1547 (Boot or Logon Autostart Execution). Cite real-world threat actor cases.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education on 'Registry Analysis' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Actor Profiling > Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) > Forensic Data Sources > Registry Analysis). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to create optimized Anki-style flashcards. Incorporate research context: Windows Registry (hives: HKLM/HKCU; keys/values/cells; slack/unallocated space). Key artifacts: Run/RunOnce (T1547 persistence), UserAssist (execution), Amcache/ShimCache (execution history). Tools: RegRipper, Registry Explorer. Address misconceptions (e.g., deletion remnants in slack). Output 50 flashcards in JSON array format: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['opt1', 'opt2', 'opt3'], 'layer': 1-4, 'blooms_level': 'REMEMBER', 'mitre': 'T1547 or N/A'}}, ...]. Ensure multiple-choice has exactly 4 options (1 correct). Balance: 25% Layer1/REMEMBER-UNDERSTAND, 25% Layer2/APPLY, 25% Layer3/ANALYZE, 25% Layer4/EVALUATE-CREATE. Make explanations pedagogical with active learning ties (e.g., 'Discuss in peers: benign vs. malicious'). High voter consensus (82.9%) prioritizes completeness on artifacts and Bloom's-structured pedagogy.
